items.question: This serial has a connection with 2004 movie Mindhunters?
items.answer: Both the stories are about criminal profiling. Other than that, there is no connection.

items.question: Please tell me Season 3 has been commissioned?
items.answer: The cast have been released from their contracts, because David Fincher will be working on other projects. Officially, it has not been cancelled but even if there is a third season, it won't be produced for a while.

items.question: In the opening of the first episode, the verb "section" is used a couple of times. The kidnapper's wife says she tried to have her husband "sectioned". This is a UK term, isn't it -- not something we say in the US? Were the writers of this series British?
items.answer: "Sectioned" means to have someone committed, preferably to a mental hospital. From Google: Involuntary commitment, civil commitment, or involuntary hospitalization (also known informally as sectioning or being sectioned in some jurisdictions, such as the United Kingdom) is a legal process through which an individual who is deemed by a qualified agent to have symptoms of severe mental disorder is detained... ALSO: 5150 is the number of the section of the Welfare and Institutions Code, which allows a person with a mental illness to be involuntarily detained for a 72-hour psychiatric hospitalization. A person on a 5150 can be held in the psychiatric hospital against their will for up to 72 hours...Bear in mind that "5150" refers to California law pertaining to a psychiatric hold... Other jurisdictions may use different codes or terminology.

items.question: Is it based on a book?
items.answer: Yes, based on the book "Mindhunter: Inside the FBI's Elite Serial Crime Unit" written by John E. Douglas and Mark Olshaker.

spoilerItems.question: Who is the "ADT Serviceman" in shown in Kansas?
spoilerItems.answer: The ADT Serviceman is Dennis Rader, aka the "BTK Killer", who killed 10 people in the Wichita, Kansas area between 1974 and 1991. Because, technically he was the last Serial Killer documented.

spoilerItems.question: Can Anyone Explain?? In Season 01 Episode 08 at 27.49 minutes They use Bittaker and Norris Tape. But Bittaker and Norris apprehended in 1979. As far as I know the plot is from 1977. So is this an innocent mistake or am I missing something here???
spoilerItems.answer: Time moves rather quickly on this show unlike a lot of shows, M.A.S.H. for example.Yes, it starts in 1977 but by early in season 2 Reagan is President.By episode 8 of season 1 it is anyones guess what year it actually is.Considering it is not a documentary I am okay with the time line making jumps without us really knowing it. The Brian Tench character will likely give them trouble since being six in 1977 and still 6 in 1981 is less than normal.
